data.title: Yummy fresh made ice cream
data.text: You can watch while they make your fresh ice cream! Love the orange honey and strawberry Balsamic! Very busy but line goes fast. Unique place to go for a treat!

data.title: Love this place!!
data.text: This is a hoppin little spot! It's always busy, but the staff is friendly and great! The ice cream is outstanding! I highly recommend the honey orange - they use local ingredients!

data.title: Ice Cream Instantly
data.text: Loved the mocha chip fast-frozen, made to order with liquid nitrogen right before my eyes. Delectable. Creamy.

data.title: A different kind of ice cream!
data.text:
This place is small, packed with people, and so good!!! 

There are only 8-0 flavors like the most popular salted caramel, chocolate orange, mint chip, orange honey, chocolate and vanilla with lavender, and balsamic strawberry. 

Everything is organic, in season, and as local as possible. Prices are very high but you are paying for the quality. 

Waffle cones are made fresh to order, the ice cream is hand frozen with liquid nitrogen freshly based on your order, and each scoop flavor has a unique topping. 

My recommendations: the mint chip was full of fresh mint flavor- not your typical peppermint extract- so the flavor was totally different to store bought ice cream. The salted caramel is what draws the crowds! It's covered in house made caramel sauce and topping with Fleur- De-Sel salt! 

There is always a long line and your scoops are called out. H name once prepared so stay close to the door to hear your order.

data.title: Pricey, but worth it!
data.text: I don't have ice cream much, but when I do this is where I go!  So Yummy!! Ingredients are all local and fresh!  The best part is that is made right in front of you!!

data.title: Magical and delicious!
data.text: A La Minute was such an unexpected pleasure. My daughter read about this place online and while we were in Redlands, moving her into the University, she asked to stop here for dessert after lunch. The menu was small but everything sounded amazing-interesting flavor combos. I thought we were waiting forever to get our ice cream when my daughter brought to my attention that they were making it to order just for us using liquid nitrogen. It was the most delicious ice cream I have ever had! Highly recommend. It's higher than what you would normally pay for ice cream bit totally worth it.

data.title: Best cool treat in Redlands
data.text: As you experience the quaint shops in Redlands, a great stop for a treat is A la Minute.  Their flavors are limited, but exceptional, freshly made, nitrogen frozen (before your eyes) ice cream.  It is one of our favorite stops to treat our friends & family.

data.title: Cool concept
data.text: Other than the price, we have no complaints. The flavor combinations are incredible so you get what you pay for. There's always a line and it's a tiny place, but you get to see your order being made.

data.title: Ice Cream at its finest -- with a twist
data.text: If you are looking for a novelty with a great taste, this is the place. My husband and I are driving across country and stopped to visit friends in Redlands. They took us to this unique ice cream store. Yummy.  The ice cream is made in front of you using liquid nitrogen -- who would have thought it.....

data.title: Best Ice Cream
data.text: Very attractive shop in historic downtown Redlands serving super high quality, made to order, ice cream.  Unique flavors using local ingredients when available.

data.title: Delicious
data.text:
It is just REALLY good ice cream!
I tried the fresh mint chip, and it is great. Real mint and really good chocolate :D

data.title: "Market Night Refresh"
data.text: A La Minute is a great place for ice cream. The dessert is made with fresh, local ingredients on site. To know the visit is always pleasurable is a treat in itself. The shop gets extremely busy. Many times there is a wait, however,  the staff is quick in getting the orders out. One of the many things I enjoy is the local artists that are dispalyed whether art or hand made bags etc. Will return for another "Market Night Refresh."

data.title: Great Ice Cream
data.text: There was a super long lineup out the door at a la minute, but the ice cream was pretty good. It is made on site and cooled with liquid nitrogen. They have some strange flavours, but to each his own. I liked that the ice cream wasn't super sweet like the store-bought ones and the scoops were a decent size! I enjoyed the freshness of the ice cream. If you visit, prepare to wait, but it is definitely worth it!

data.title: Outstanding Ice Cream
data.text: It's a bit pricey but once in a while you just have to splurge.  They flavor their ice cream with outstanding local ingredients.  Very much recommended!

data.title: Good ice cream, made on site
data.text: Good ice cream, made on site at the store with mainly local ingredients, always busy during the summer months

data.title: Delicious ice cream!
data.text: This is my wife's favorite ice cream on the whole planet (we've traveled all over the place eating ice cream). The flavors are somewhat unique and once you order they mix the ingredients in a mixing bowl and then instantly freeze them with liquid nitrogen which is fun to watch. The ice cream that comes out is very flavorful.

data.title: Excellent home made ice cream
data.text: Very unique way of making ice cream with liquid nitrogen and super fresh and delicious! If you're looking for unique this is it!!! Worth it!!!

data.title: Excellent homemade ice cream
data.text:
Homemade ice cream with original flavors.
We tried the Strawberry Balsamic & the Salted Carmel and they both were excellent!! As a heads up there is no where to sit inside as it's very small and just for ordering but there are several bench's  outside.

data.title: Worth Every Calorie
data.text:
Went after Parliament Chocolate told us about this ice cream shop, they use their chocolate here. Liquid Nitrogen is used to flash freeze the ice cream. This tiny shop has no tables or chairs but it is in a town where you want to take your ice cream and go strolling. 

Olive oil, chocolate lavender, mint chocolate, strawberry balsamic...and other flavors that are OH-SO-FULL of flavor!!! I went back and tried them all...yes them all!

I loved this cute place, the folks that took care of us and the town. Pick up a Parliament chocolate bar on your way out.

data.title: Leave room for dessert
data.text: My wife and I both tried the salted caramel.  Scrumptious!!!  The long line/wait pays huge dividends if you can get past that.
